subsc: Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Contractual Savings Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project for Uruguay supports the development
            of the capitalized system of individual pension accounts,
            established as part of Uruguay's 1996 pension reform.
            Pension reform success depends on the level of pension
            benefits that the capitalization regime can provide its
            affiliates. Good financial performance by the capitalization
            regime would only be achieved if the AFAPs (Pension Fund
            Administrators) are able to invest in relatively high return
            marketable securities and reduce their operating costs. This
            loan supports a number of measures to 1) liberalize the
            investment regime of the AFAPs to allow greater investment
            in private securities; 2) increase the availability of
            private securities to match the growth of capitalized
            pension funds; and 3) create incentives to improve cost
            consciousness among the AFAPs and transparency in reporting.
